contributor: jay i. kislak collection (library of congress)
description: Relief shown pictorially. Includes text and illustrations. Bound in the Schöner Sammelband. Sheet 6 appears to be a proof copy and was laid in after the Sammelband was bound. All sheets except for sheet 6 annotated in ink and red ink by Johann Schöner. All sheets bear a watermark of a triple pointed crown. Sheet 9 has a paper patch within a shield covering over corrections. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Provenance: Gift of Jay I. Kislak Foundation.

contributors: Jay I. Kislak Collection (Library of Congress)

description: Relief shown pictorially. First document known to name America. Red ink grid on 2 sheets. Text applied over blank areas on 2 sheets. Manuscript annotations in the margin of 1 sheet. All sheets bear a watermark of a triple pointed crown. Two stamps on verso of upper left hand sheet: Fürstl. Waldburg Wolfegg'sches Kupferstichkabinett -- Furstl. Waldbg. Wolf. Bibliothek. Exhibited: Rivers, edens, empires: Lewis & Clark and the revealing of America, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C., July 24-Nov. 29, 2003. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Includes text and ill. Printed surrogate in vault available for reference. LC digital image is a composite map from the twelve separate sheets. Originally bound with Waldseemüller's 1516 Carta marina in the Schöner Sammelband.

medium: 1 map on 12 sheets ; 128 x 233 cm., sheets 46 x 63 cm. or smaller.
notes: Relief shown pictorially.
First document known to name America.
Red ink grid on 2 sheets. Text applied over blank areas on 2 sheets. Manuscript annotations in the margin of 1 sheet.

description: General-content regional map of 3 towns (townships) in N.Y. State showing rural buildings and householders' names. Also gives orientation data for the segment lines of the township boundaries. Relief shown by hachures. Does not show real property or cadastral data. "This map is an exact copy from the original on a scale of 80 ch's to an inch." "Scale of original map 40 ch's to an inch." "This map executed for the Doc. His. of St. of N.Y. by directions of the Hon. Ch's Morgan, Sec. of State, May 1850, Albany." LC copy imperfect: Fold-lined, part of left margin torn/cut away. LC Land ownership maps, 486 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. 2 copies

call_number: G3804.L55 1798 .W5 Copy 2 Taped on verso, mounted on cloth backing, not fold-lined.

contributor: confederate states of america. army. arkansas district. topographical bureau
description: Shows rivers, streams, fords, roads, farm land, tree types, houses, and names of some residents. Mounted on cloth. LC stamped in black ink at lower left corner. On verso in pencil at upper right: Land Ownership Maps #7. Hand written label on verso: No. 22  Z.61  Book.  alhoun County, Arkansas. Stamped on verso in blue ink: By Transfer, Chief Engineers Office, War Department, Apr 30 1931. Circular insignia at lower left corner: Topographical Bureau Dist. Arks., April 8th 1865. Imperfect: Folded, creased, and stained throughout. Accompanied by: text. LC Land ownership maps, 7 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
